US Universities are another option.  In general, US Ph.D. programs 
provide=
 financial support to their students thoughout the process.  
The support u=
sually comes from a TAship, RAship, or some kind of 
fellowship.  Usually y=
ou might start out as a TA and later be hired 
as an RA by your advisor.  S=
upport generally includes tuition and 
fees in addition to normal salary.  =
I was told when I was applying 
to grad schools that if a Ph.D. program acc=
epts you without any 
assurance of support, they probably don't really want=
 you.

You definitely do not need a Masters degree of any type in order to =

start a Ph.D. in the US, although sometimes a Masters might help you 
get =
in if it improved your credentials in terms of demonstrating 
research prom=
ise.  But I enrolled directly from undergrad without a 
Masters.  It's impo=
rtant to note though that a lot of people acquire 
a Masters in the course =
of their Ph.D. as a kind of safety net in 
case things don't work out.  In =
general, it's very little extra work 
to get a Masters along the way since =
it overlaps with your Ph.D.  

US Universities you might consider are prett=
y obvious:  University 
of Texas at Austin is the leading place for this ki=
nd of research in 
the country at this time.  University of Central Florida=
 will 
hopefully soon be a significant place as well after I join their 
fa=
culty and build up a group.  I am hoping to focus on exactly the 
issues yo=
u identified as interesting.  UCF also has the nice 
situation that it also=
 has an evolutionary computation person (Annie 
Wu) and a neural net person=
 (Michael Georgiopoulos).  The DEMO group 
at Brandeis University, headed b=
y Jordan Pollack, has also produced 
a lot of good work (http://www.demo.cs=
.brandeis.edu/) in the area.  

Other people on the group may have other su=
ggestions.  I know Derek 
James recently got into a Cognitive Science progr=
am in Louisiana 
that will allow him to puruse neuroevolution research.   A=
 number of 
people in this group have sought or are seeking graduate educat=
ion 
in this area.
